ygData.subject: Re: [archive-crawler] URI Canonicalization Rules problem
ygData.msgSnippet: Hello Markus, Thanks for this report, you ve brought to light a bug in the code and a mistake in the documentation which conspired to produce this obtuse

Subject: Re: [archive-crawler] URI Canonicalization Rules problem
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=325624130; y=m0fARvvBzh4k9NdkaoVR3kSAYx6yNjhKWGI7asiaPwTV2g
X-Yahoo-Profile: nlevitt

Hello Markus,

Thanks for this report, you've brought to light a bug in the code and a 
mistake in the documentation which conspired to produce this obtuse error.

First problem is the exception you got:

java.lang.IllegalStateException: Can't overwrite cause
	at java.lang.Throwable.initCause(Throwable.java:320)
	at org.archive.spring.Sheet.prime(Sheet.java:152)

It was thrown in the process of handling the real exception, preventing 
the real stack trace from making it into the log. I've checked in a fix 
for that - https://webarchive.jira.com/source/changelog/HER?cs=7235

With that change in place, the real problem is revealed:

2011-08-30T22:56:24.688Z SEVERE Failed to convert property value of type 
'java.lang.String' to required type 
'org.archive.modules.canonicalize.UriCanonicalizationPolicy' for 
property 'canonicalizationPolicy';

As you mentioned, you were using this snippet as recommended by the wiki 
page:

<entry key='preparer.canonicalizationPolicy' 
value='altCanonicalizationPolicy'/> <!-- wrong -->

But instead it should look like this:

<entry key='preparer.canonicalizationPolicy'>
<ref bean='altCanonicalizationPolicy'/>
</entry>

I've fixed the doc. 
https://webarchive.jira.com/wiki/display/Heritrix/URI+Canonicalization+Rules

Noah



On 08/30/2011 12:28 PM, mirschi74 wrote:
> Hi,
>
> I have a problem implementing the URI Canonicalization Rule described here: https://webarchive.jira.com/wiki/display/Heritrix/URI+Canonicalization+Rules
>
> When I implement it on Heritrix Engine 3.1.0-SNAPSHOT-20110721.001335 like it is described in the documentation the IllegalStateException I copied below will be thrown as soon as I try to build my job.
>
> The exception will be thrown when this line appears in the canonicalizationPolicySheet bean:
> <entry key='preparer.canonicalizationPolicy' value='altCanonicalizationPolicy'/>
>
> It seems like it doesnt matter what i write inside the altcaonicalizationPolicy bean. Just the fact that I try to use it throws an exception.
>
> Does anyone have an idea what might be the problem? Im searching two days now but cant find anything.
>
> Thanks in advance,
> Markus
>
>
>
>
>
>
>
